alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 25 at 3:10PM PST until December 28 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches, except 1 to 2 feet above 7000 feet along and west of Highway 395. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph, with Sierra ridges gusting as high as 110 mph. For Monday-Tuesday, an additional 8-16 inches possible west of Highway 395, with 4-8" possible along and east of US-395. * WHERE...Mono County. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage.
info.instruction: Avoid travel if possible, you could be stuck in your vehicle for many hours. If you must travel, prepare for long delays and carry an emergency kit with extra food, water and clothing. If you stay home, have a backup plan in case of power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
